column4: hey guys can someone point me in the direction to a gui based software raid program?
is there a gui for mdadm?
i don't think so
you aware of a gui based tool to set up a software raid 5 setup.
you are gonna have to use command line, which you will be thankful for if anything goes wrong later
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/SoftwareRAID
those guides are all for if your installing the os onto the Raid Array. Im not
http://www.linuxhomenetworking.com/wiki/index.php/Quick_HOWTO_:_Ch26_:_Linux_Software_RAID
you are not gonna get much better than that step-by-step tute I sent you
did you partition them first?
partitioned as raid disks (autodetect)
can i pm you the output of fdisk -l?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/41615/
did you reboot after partitioning
used in raid to keep track of what disk is where
can you look at this for me please
here is a Fdisk of my drives
you left out partition numbers /dev/sda1
i don't think it is the problem, but get rid of the \ after level=5
cat /proc/mdstat
http://paste.ubuntu.com/41630/
could be http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=129498
